name: Sipping Champagne in the Champagne Region
description: Experience the exclusivity of tasting authentic Champagne in the picturesque region where it is produced.

suggested_venues.name: Moët & Chandon
suggested_venues.description: Renowned for its Impérial champagne, this historic maison offers guided tours and tastings.

suggested_venues.name: Veuve Clicquot
suggested_venues.description: Famous for its premium labels, it provides cellar tours and a glimpse into the champagne-making process.

suggested_venues.name: Taittinger
suggested_venues.description: A family-run house known for its Chardonnay dominant blends, offering insightful cellar tours.

suggested_venues.name: Dom Pérignon
suggested_venues.description: Prestigious label, offering exclusive tastings and tours by appointment, known for its vintage champagnes.

name: Dining at a Michelin Star Restaurant in Paris
description: Indulge in an unparalleled culinary experience at one of Paris's many Michelin-starred restaurants.

suggested_venues.name: Le Jules Verne
suggested_venues.description: Located in the Eiffel Tower, it offers haute cuisine with an exceptional view of Paris.
suggested_venues.location: Eiffel Tower, Avenue Gustave Eiffel, 75007 Paris, France

suggested_venues.name: L'Astrance
suggested_venues.description: A small, intimate venue known for its innovative and artistic culinary creations.

suggested_venues.name: Arpège
suggested_venues.description: Famed for its vegetable-focused menu, this restaurant offers a unique twist on French cuisine.

suggested_venues.name: Le Cinq
suggested_venues.description: Elegant dining in the Four Seasons Hotel George V, known for its classic French dishes and extensive wine list.

name: Exploring the Palace of Versailles
description: Walk through the opulent halls of the Palace of Versailles, which was once the centre of political power in France.

suggested_venues.name: Hall of Mirrors
suggested_venues.description: The most famous room in the palace, featuring 17 mirrored arches reflecting 17 windows overlooking the gardens.
suggested_venues.location: Palace of Versailles, Place d'Armes, 78000 Versailles, France

suggested_venues.name: Gardens of Versailles
suggested_venues.description: Sprawling over 800 hectares, these meticulously designed gardens are a masterpiece of French landscaping.
suggested_venues.location: Palace of Versailles, Place d'Armes, 78000 Versailles, France

suggested_venues.name: The Grand Trianon
suggested_venues.description: A smaller palace on the grounds of Versailles, known for its pink marble and French Neoclassical architecture.
suggested_venues.location: The Grand Trianon, Place d'Armes, 78000 Versailles, France

suggested_venues.name: The Queen's Hamlet
suggested_venues.description: A rustic retreat built for Marie Antoinette, featuring a charming village with gardens and farm buildings.
suggested_venues.location: The Queen's Hamlet, Place d'Armes, 78000 Versailles, France

name: Skiing in the French Alps
description: Hit the slopes in the world-renowned ski resorts of the French Alps, offering some of the best skiing experiences on the planet.

suggested_venues.name: Chamonix
suggested_venues.description: World-famous ski resort, offering challenging slopes and spectacular views of Mont Blanc.

suggested_venues.name: Courchevel
suggested_venues.description: Part of the largest ski area in the world, known for its varied ski runs and luxury accommodations.

suggested_venues.name: Val d'Isère
suggested_venues.description: Combines high-quality skiing with a lively apres-ski scene, suitable for all levels.

suggested_venues.name: Meribel
suggested_venues.description: Located in the heart of the Three Valleys, known for its charming alpine architecture and extensive ski area.

name: Attending a Cooking Class in Lyon
description: Learn the art of French cooking in Lyon, considered the gastronomic capital of France.

suggested_venues.name: Plum Lyon
suggested_venues.description: Offers hands-on cooking classes focusing on traditional Lyonnaise cuisine in a cozy kitchen setting.
suggested_venues.location: 49 Rue des Tables Claudiennes, 69001 Lyon, France

suggested_venues.name: L'Atelier des Chefs
suggested_venues.description: Provides a range of cooking workshops from beginner to advanced, emphasizing fresh, local ingredients.

suggested_venues.name: Cuisine et Croix-Rousse
suggested_venues.description: Specializes in small group classes, teaching both classic and modern French cooking techniques.
suggested_venues.location: 13 Grande Rue de la Croix-Rousse, 69004 Lyon, France

suggested_venues.name: In Cuisine
suggested_venues.description: A unique combination of a cooking school and bookstore, offering a variety of culinary classes and events.

name: Visiting the Louvre Museum
description: See the Mona Lisa and thousands of other masterpieces at the world's most visited museum.

suggested_venues.name: Plum Lyon
suggested_venues.description: Offers hands-on cooking classes focusing on traditional Lyonnaise cuisine in a cozy kitchen setting.
suggested_venues.location: 49 Rue des Tables Claudiennes, 69001 Lyon, France

suggested_venues.name: L'Atelier des Chefs
suggested_venues.description: Provides a range of cooking workshops from beginner to advanced, emphasizing fresh, local ingredients.

suggested_venues.name: Cuisine et Croix-Rousse
suggested_venues.description: Specializes in small group classes, teaching both classic and modern French cooking techniques.
suggested_venues.location: 13 Grande Rue de la Croix-Rousse, 69004 Lyon, France

suggested_venues.name: In Cuisine
suggested_venues.description: A unique combination of a cooking school and bookstore, offering a variety of culinary classes and events.

name: Wine Tasting in Bordeaux
description: Enjoy a variety of wine tasting tours in the Bordeaux region, famous for its vineyards and fine wines.

suggested_venues.name: Château Margaux
suggested_venues.description: One of the leading wine estates in Bordeaux, offering guided tours and tastings of its prestigious wines.

suggested_venues.name: Château Latour
suggested_venues.description: Known for its powerful, full-bodied wines, this estate offers a deep insight into the winemaking process.

suggested_venues.name: Château Mouton Rothschild
suggested_venues.description: Famous for its rich, opulent wines and the art labels on each vintage bottle.

suggested_venues.name: Château Lafite Rothschild
suggested_venues.description: Renowned for its elegant wines, this estate combines tradition with modern winemaking techniques.

name: Sunbathing in Nice on the French Riviera
description: Relax on the beautiful beaches of Nice or stroll along the Promenade des Anglais.

suggested_venues.name: Promenade des Anglais
suggested_venues.description: A legendary waterfront promenade along the Mediterranean, perfect for strolls and beachside relaxation.

suggested_venues.name: Blue Beach
suggested_venues.description: A popular private beach with sun loungers, umbrellas, and a restaurant offering Mediterranean cuisine.

suggested_venues.name: Castel Plage
suggested_venues.description: Located at the foot of Castle Hill, this beach offers a more secluded spot with restaurant facilities.

suggested_venues.name: Ruhl Plage
suggested_venues.description: One of the oldest private beaches in Nice, known for its vibrant atmosphere and excellent service.

name: Taking a River Cruise on the Seine
description: See the sights of Paris from a different perspective on a scenic river cruise.

suggested_venues.name: Bateaux Parisiens
suggested_venues.description: Offers a variety of Seine River cruises, including sightseeing tours and dinner cruises.
suggested_venues.location: Port de la Bourdonnais, 75007 Paris, France

suggested_venues.name: Vedettes de Paris
suggested_venues.description: Provides intimate boat tours, offering unique views of Paris's most famous landmarks.

suggested_venues.name: Paris en Scène
suggested_venues.description: Features modern, glass-covered boats for dinner cruises, providing an elegant dining experience.

suggested_venues.name: Batobus
suggested_venues.description: A hop-on, hop-off riverboat service, allowing visitors to explore Paris at their own pace from the water.
suggested_venues.location: Port de l'Hôtel de Ville, 75004 Paris, France

name: Exploring Mont Saint-Michel
description: Visit the iconic island commune in Normandy, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

suggested_venues.name: Abbey of Mont Saint-Michel
suggested_venues.description: A stunning example of medieval architecture, this abbey is perched atop the island and offers breathtaking views.

suggested_venues.name: La Grande Rue
suggested_venues.description: The main street of the island, lined with historic buildings, shops, and eateries.

suggested_venues.name: Musée Historique
suggested_venues.description: A museum showcasing the history of Mont Saint-Michel, including medieval armor and old prison cells.

suggested_venues.name: Le Grand Degré
suggested_venues.description: The grand staircase leading to the abbey, offering a scenic route through the heart of Mont Saint-Michel.
suggested_venues.location: Le Grand Degré, 50170 Mont Saint-Michel, France
